DataElement.preferredName: Index Date to Effusion and/or Serum Marker Test Day Count
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Number of days between the date used for index and the date the effusion and/or serum tumor marker test was performed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Index Date To Effusion and/or Serum Tumor Marker Test Day
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A date used as a reference point for ensuing events, often a diagnosis date, or a first visit date, or the date a patient enrolled in a study._Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement._A collection of fluid in a body cavity, which may be the result of a non-neoplastic disorder (e.g. heart failure) or a tumor (e.g. carcinoma of the lung)._Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid._A laboratory test in which a monoclonal antibody is used to detect a tumor-specific marker in a blood sample._The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A date used as a reference point for ensuing events, often a diagnosis date, or a first visit date, or the date a patient enrolled in a study.

Concepts.definition: A date used as a reference point for ensuing events, often a diagnosis date, or a first visit date, or the date a patient enrolled in a study.

Property.preferredName: To Effusion And/Or Serum Tumor Marker Test Day
Property.preferredDefinition: Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.:A collection of fluid in a body cavity, which may be the result of a non-neoplastic disorder (e.g. heart failure) or a tumor (e.g. carcinoma of the lung).:Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.:A laboratory test in which a monoclonal antibody is used to detect a tumor-specific marker in a blood sample.:The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.

Concepts.definition: Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
A collection of fluid in a body cavity, which may be the result of a non-neoplastic disorder (e.g. heart failure) or a tumor (e.g. carcinoma of the lung).
Used to indicate that either or both of two items or options may be valid.
A laboratory test in which a monoclonal antibody is used to detect a tumor-specific marker in a blood sample.
The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for HCMI: Mesothelioma Curation Request 2/25/21 mc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past._The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours._To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

Concepts.definition: The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.
The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.
Determining the number or amount of something.
